#Text=Families appeal to Spain 's government to negotiate with Somali pirates
#Text=Sunday , November 8 , 2009
#Text=Somalia
#Text=Image : Hipi Zhdripi .
#Text=Families of Spanish sailors being held for over a month appealed to Spain 's government on Friday to negotiate with the Somali pirates for their release .
#Text=The kidnappers have threatened to kill three of the tuna trawler 's crew after a stand-off with Spanish forces .
#Text=They called upon the government to free two captured Somalis held in Spain , who are suspected of being involved in the seizure of the Alakrana and its crew of 36 .
#Text=As in the case with the Lynn Rival , a British yacht , the kidnappers have demanded their release .

#Text=Ricardo Blach , the captain of the trawler who is being held by the pirates , warned relatives by phone that they intended to kill the three crew members — moved from the trawler on Thursday and returned on Friday in a bid to pressure the Spanish government — should their demands not be met .
#Text=" They have just told us that if in three days there is no change over the two held in Spain , they will kill the three and then three others and then more , " he said .
#Text=The Spanish government has ruled this out , but is willing to hand them over to an African country , such as Kenya , as happened in May .

#Text=" That is an issue for the courts to decide , " commented Deputy Prime Minister María Teresa Fernández de la Vega Sanz to reporters , adding that talking about this " technical topic which is legally very complicated " was " risky " .

#Text= If we remain calm and confident I am certain that what all Spaniards what , what the families want , what the government wants — that the hostages can return to their homes safe and sound and this kidnapping ends satisfactorily . "

column1: #Text=Families say the captured crew have " little drinking water or food , " .
#Text=They called for Spanish authorities to " act immediately " and " do everything possible to bring home the 36 fishermen . "
#Text=in a joint statement .

#Text=" We demand that all the parties work in the same direction " and requested that the Spanish government chooses " negotiation " as opposed to risking the life of the crew in danger by forceful means .
#Text=The pirates captured the boat on October 2 , and are demanding US$ 4 ( € 2.6 ) million in ransom in addition to the release of the two captured Somalis .
#Text=The crew comprises sixteen Spaniards , the crew includes eight Indonesians and members from Ghana , the Ivory Coast , Madagascar , Senegal and the Seychelles .
#Text=Spanish military captured the two suspected pirates when they left the trawler via a small boat .
#Text=On Friday , Spain 's secretary of state for defence , Constantino Mendez , insisted that their release " is not negotiable . "
#Text=He announced on Spanish National Radio that the hostages are " in good health " and that the kidnappers are " dramatising " the situation as a " negotiating tactic . "
#Text=Two Spanish frigates are observing the situation off the Somali coast .
